reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last year for one night during our motorbike tour enroute to Lake Lucern. Great hotel about a 10 minute walk from the busy area of town, but it was a lovely walk. The hotel itself was nice, the room was spotless, a decent size room considering we had all our bike gear. The staff were friendly & welcoming, one of the only hotels that didn't charge us for secure parking for the bike :)
reviews.title: Really nice, clean & comfortable. Staff great & helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I came across The Lyskirchen whilst looking for a deal on Expedia for a weekend away in Cologne. I've often visited the city, and know my way around, so was looking for something pretty central.
reviews.title: Perfect medium-size hotel near centre of Cologne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lyskirchen is a 10/15 minute walk from what i'd call "the main attractions" (Dom/train station, etc) but not so far away that it's in a suburb or undesirable area.
reviews.title: Decent Room but airconditioning anemic

reviews.text: It's positioned on a one-way street next to the river Rhine (the walkway along side the river takes you directly into town & the train station) and from the outside looks like a small inn, rather than a hotel with a swimming pool and other amenities!
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On my arrival, the staff were very friendly, check-in was quick & easy, and they answered any queries I had promptly.
reviews.title: great little hotel with decent facilities and close to major sights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time in Cologne! This hotel was a bit of a walk to the sites but its so easy to walk in this city, though, cobblestone isn't the best for rolling luggage. We found a few excellent german bar/ restaurants about a mile west of the hotel, or walk north on the riverwalk for cute, more touristy restaurants.
reviews.title: Modern, yet cozy

reviews.text: The hotel staff was very friendly and even opened the snack bar for us to get a candybar when we came in late one night!
reviews.title: Fine hotel oh Rhine

reviews.text: The decor was a bit too modern for me. The glass shower door did not close (by design) and the water sprayed out, soaking whatever was on the bathroom floor.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel next to the Rhine

reviews.text: Not much to say about this hotel - everything was very clean, nice and quiet. What more to ask? Sauna and swimming pool are a nice addition. A bit distant from the Dom, but on the other hand, located on quiet street, away from main traffic - certainly is an advantage. I had some problem with the final bill (was a bit more than the price of booking at booking.com) - but it was solved quickly. I guess, such things could happen anywhere (however, you least expect it in Germany with its famous accuracy :)). Overall - consider this plce for next trip to Cologne.
reviews.title: Good location. Very good facilities.

reviews.text: This is a very well-run hotel, with pleasant and efficient staff. The room I had was nicely furnished and immaculate. Breakfast was excellent, with a good choice, although it was a bit expensive (18 euros, if I remember correctly). The swimming pool was reasonably sized - when I used it there was no on else around, neither staff nor guests. The location of the hotel is just across the road from the riverside promenade, about fifteen minutes from the main station and cathedral, and therefore within walking distance from most of the main attractions of this congenial city.
reviews.title: Good overnight stay.

reviews.text: The room was very big and comfortable and Heumarkt was just around the corner.
reviews.title: Comfortable
Three-star masquerading as four-star
reviews.text: The breakfast and wi fi are unduly expensive and the same applies for the room rate, but we had been expecting that since we visited during a fair.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The heating was not sufficient enough and neither was the ventilation.
reviews.title: Better than I thought, and cheap too!

reviews.text: I have poor things to say about the quality of the service at Hotel Lyskirchen in Cologne. The room itself was nice but other things soured on me such as:
reviews.title: Just Ok

reviews.text: 18.50 euros per person for breakfast buffet
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The kids enjoyed the pool. The location was within easy walking distance of the cathedral and chocolate museum. My wife found it a little far from the train station dragging luggage. We took a cab when leaving instead and it was fairly cheap and worth it.
reviews.title: Close enough to sights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After arriving in Cologne from Sweden (expensive crappy beer) I was thrilled about the cheap and tasty Kolsch beer (Sion was the best one I tried) and giant pretzels.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night while visiting the Christmas market in November and would not hesitate to recommend the place.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendly and accomodating to our requests. Nice to get a hotel with a pool and sauna for this price, great way to relax before/after hitting the markets. Also nice after the trip up the Cathedral's tower!
reviews.title: Good location. Horrible staff

reviews.text: This hotel was booked for a short lesiure stay, for the Christmas markets, and I would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Lovely Lyskirchen
